flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
With the use of a small lens and a piece of polycarbonate or acrylic plastic for a lens holder, you can keep the macro lens in your pocket and just hold it in front of your camera's lens that will permit it to focus within an inch of your subject.

All that is needed is a small diameter lens, preferably an achromatic lens, that fits into a hole drilled into a piece of plastic used for the lens holder. When you're not taking macro photographs, just slip the lens holder into your pocket or a small envelope to protect the lens surfaces.

guide.summary: SmartPhones and Tablet cameras have great resolution these days, and it's easy to add a supplementary lens to take amazing close-up, macro photographs.
guide.title: Turn your SmartPhone or Tablet camera into a Macro Camera
